I never said anything about negative stuff about Bush being propaganda. If it's true, then use it. If it's not, I'll sure as hell let you know about i emoticon_xbye

I knew you'd say that. 
 
 It's hard to find a source anywhere that somebody won't see as being biased.
 
 Everyone is allowed to present whatever they wish. I imagine that we are all prone to present only our side of the argument.
 
 I'm just saying that the barrage of propaganda slide shows is likely to go unwatched, as is Farenheit 9-11.

 
 There is such a thing as entertainment.
 It's strange, I suppose, that some people are entertained by things of a political nature, but they are. The little flash cartoons, like most anything, just take some information and present it in such a way as to favor one point of view. Propaganda is a merely sales pitch for a point of view, if you will. A bad form of propaganda is very deceptive, like when the news, which is supposed to be impartial, is biased to one point of view. 
 
 If one would rather keep one's mind closed to certain things, that is one's prerogative. I don't see how one can complain about a silly cartoon or a movie that one has not seen. If one would like to complain about something, then maybe one should know what one is talking about. If one takes the time to complain about something, maybe one should see what one is complaining about. Or two, rather.
 
 But, maybe you didn't see the flashes about Kerry. They are harder to find than ones about Bush, mainly because the entire world (except 42% of those polled in the US) has been busy hating Bush for almost four years.
